200.description: Session object information

get.description: To get session object information, use this endpoint

200.description: Successfully logged out and token invalidated

post.description: To log a user out of the current session, use this endpoint

password.description: The password of the user account

secretKey.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates this secret key when you enable trusted authentication.

accessLevel.description:
User access privilege. 

 FULL - Creates a session with full access. 

 REPORT_BOOK_VIEW - Allow view access to the specified visualizations.
accessLevel.title: getToken-accessLevel

tsObjectId.description: GUID of the ThoughtSpot object. If you have set the accessLevel attribute to REPORT_BOOK_VIEW, specify the GUID of the Liveboard or visualization object.

tokenExpiryDuration.description: Provide duration in seconds after which the token should expire

orgId.description:
This is applicable only if organization feature is enabled in the cluster. 

 Id of the organization to be associated with the user login. If no input is provided then last logged in organization will be considered.

200.description: Token generated successfully

post.description:
To programmatically create session token for a user in ThoughtSpot, use this endpoint. 

 You can generate the token for a user by providing password or secret key from the cluster. 

 You need to enable trusted authentication to generate secret key. To generate secret key, follow below steps. 

 1. Click the Develop tab. 

 2. Under Customizations, click Settings. 

 3. To enable trusted authentication, turn on the toggle. 

 4. A secret_key for trusted authentication is generated. 

 5. Click the clipboard icon to copy the token. 

 

 Password is given precedence over secretKey input, when both are included in the request.

200.description: Token revoked successfully

post.description: To expire or revoke a token for a user, use this endpoint

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Username of the user that you want to query

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID of the user account to query

200.description: Details of the user

get.description:
To get the details of a specific user account by username or user id, use this endpoint. At Least one value is needed. When both are given,then user id will be considered to fetch user information 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

name.description: Name of the user account. The username string must be unique.

displayName.description: A display name string for the user, usually their first and last name.

visibility.description:
Visibility of the user. The visibility attribute is set to DEFAULT when creating a user. 

 The DEFAULT attribute makes a user visible to other users and user groups, and thus allows them to share objects.
visibility.title: createUser-visibility

mail.description: Email id associated with the user account

orgIds.description:
This is applicable only if organization feature is enabled in the cluster. 

 Array of org identifiers. If no value is provided, the organization associated with the login session is considered.

groups.description: A JSON array of group names or GUIDs or both. When both are given then id is considered

state.description: Status of user account. acitve or inactive.

showWalkMe.title: createUser-showWalkMe

analystOnboardingComplete.title: createUser-analystOnboardingComplete
analystOnboardingComplete.description:
ThoughtSpot provides an interactive guided walkthrough to onboard new users. The onboarding experience leads users through a set of actions to help users get started and accomplish their tasks quickly. 

 The users can turn off the Onboarding experience and access it again when they need assistance with the ThoughtSpot UI.

type.description: Type of user. LOCAL_USER indicates that the user is created locally in the ThoughtSpot system.
type.title: createUser-type

200.description: Details of the user created

post.description:
To programmatically create a user account in the ThoughtSpot system, use this API endpoint. 

 Using this API, you can create a user and assign groups. To create a user, you require admin user privileges. 

 All users created in the ThoughtSpot system are added to ALL user group. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

 The visibility attribute is set to DEFAULT when creating a user. The DEFAULT attribute makes a user visible to other users and user groups, and thus allows them to share objects.

get.description:
To get the details of a specific group by name or id, use this endpoint. 

 At least one value needed. When both are given,then id will be considered to fetch user information.

200.description: Details of the group created

post.description:
To programmatically create a group in the ThoughtSpot system, use this API endpoint. 

 Using this API, you can create a group and assign privileges and users. 

 For ease of user management and access control, ThoughtSpot administrations can create groups and assign privileges to these groups. 

 The privileges determine the actions that the users belonging to a group are allowed to do. 

 ThoughtSpot also has a default group called ALL. When you create new group in ThoughtSpot, they are automatically added to ALL user group. You cannot delete the ALL user group or remove members from it. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

id.description: GUID of the group to update

displayName.description: A unique display name string for the user group, for example, Developer group.

visibility.description:
Visibility of the user group. 

 The visibility attribute is set to DEFAULT. The DEFAULT attribute makes the user group visible for other user groups and allows them to share objects.
visibility.title: updateGroup-visibility

privileges.description: A JSON array of privileges assigned to the group

groups.description: A JSON array of group names or GUIDs or both. When both are given then id is considered

users.description: A JSON array of name of users or GUIDs of users or both. When both are given then id is considered

assignedLiveboards.description: An array of liveboard ids to be assigned to the group.

type.description: Type of user group. LOCAL_GROUP indicates that the user is created locally in the ThoughtSpot system.
type.title: updateGroup-type

To get header detail of a metadata object, use this endpoint. You can provide as input selective fields to get the data for. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege for USER and USER_GROUP type. Requires datamanagement privilege for CONNECTION type. Requires at least view access for other object types

 Permission: Requires administration privilege for USER and USER_GROUP type. Requires datamanagement privilege for CONNECTION type. Requires at least view access to other object types

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID of the liveboard or answer

200.description: Header details of vizualization charts in the liveboard/answer object

get.description:
Use this endpoint to get header details of visualization charts for a given liveboard or answer. 

 At least one of id or name of liveboard or answer is required. When both are given, then id will be considered. 

 Permission: Requires at least view access to the object

outputFields.description: Array of header field names that need to be included in the header response

offset.description:
The offset point, starting from where the records should be included in the response.

 If no input is provided then offset starts from 0.

batchNumber.description:
An alternate way to set offset for the starting point of the response. 

 The value in offset field will not be considered if batchNumber field has value greater than 0. 

 Offset value will be calculated as (batchNumber - 1) * batchSize. 

 It is mandatory to provide a value for batchSize with batchNumber. 

 Example: 

 Assume response has 100 records. Now,  batchNumber is set as 2 and batchSize as 10, then offset value will be 10. So, 10 records starting from 11th record will be considered.

batchSize.description:
The number of records that should be included in the response starting from offset position. 

 If no input is provided, then all records starting from the value provided in offset is included in the response.

sortBy.description: Field based on which the response needs to be ordered.
sortBy.title: searchObjectHeader-sortBy

sortOrder.description: Order in which sortBy should be applied.
sortOrder.title: searchObjectHeader-sortOrder

type.description: Type of the metadata object being searched.
type.title: searchObjectHeader-type

namePattern.description: A pattern to match the name of the metadata object. This parameter supports matching case-insensitive strings. For a wildcard match, use %.

fetchId.description: A JSON array containing the GUIDs of the metadata objects that you want to fetch.

skipId.description: A JSON array containing the GUIDs of the metadata objects that you want to skip.

showHidden.title: searchObjectHeader-showHidden
showHidden.description: When set to true, returns details of the hidden objects, such as a column in a worksheet or a table.

autoCreated.title: searchObjectHeader-autoCreated
autoCreated.description: A flag to indicate whether to list only the auto created objects. When no value is provided as input then all objects are returned.

accessLevel.description: A JSON array of objects with user details for which the metadata objects should be considered from the repository If you specify ID or name of user and set the type parameter to USER, the API returns metadata objects associated with the user If you specify ID or name of user group and set the type parameter to USER_GROUP, the API returns metadata objects for all the users mapped to the specified user group. If the id or name parameter is not defined, but the type attribute is set to USER or USER_GROUP, then the API will not return and response. If no input is provided for any field for this object, then the API returns headers for all users. If both name and id is provided, then id will be considered.

tag.description: A JSON array of name or GUID of tags or both. When both are given then id is considered.

favoriteFor.description: A JSON array of name or GUID of the user or both for whom the object is assigned as favorite. When both are given then id is considered.

author.description: A JSON array of name or GUID of the user or both who created the object. When both are given then id is considered.

lastModifiedBy.description: A JSON array of name or GUID of the user or both who last modified the object. When both are given then id is considered.

200.description: Header details based on the search criteria and requested output fields

To get header details for metadata objects, use this endpoint. You can provide as input selective fields to get the data for. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege for USER and USER_GROUP type. Requires datamanagement privilege for CONNECTION type. Requires at least view access for other object types

type.description: Type of the metadata object being searched. Valid values
type.title: searchObjectDetail-type

id.description: A JSON array of GUIDs of the objects.

showHidden.title: searchObjectDetail-showHidden
showHidden.description: When set to true, returns details of the hidden objects, such as a column in a worksheet or a table.

dropQuestionDetails.title: searchObjectDetail-dropQuestionDetails
dropQuestionDetails.description: When set to true, the search assist data associated with a worksheet is not included in the API response. This attribute is applicable only for DATAOBJECT data type.

version.description: Specify the version to retrieve the objects from. By default, the API returns metadata for all versions of the object.

Use this endpoint to get full details of metadata objects. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege for USER and USER_GROUP type. Requires datamanagement privilege for CONNECTION type. Requires at least view access for other object types

parameters.description: A JSON array of GUIDs of the objects.

Use this endpoint to delete the metadata objects.  

 Permission: Requires modify access to the object

type.description: Type of the data object
type.title: getObjectDependency-type

id.description: A JSON array of GUIDs of the objects

batchSize.description:
The maximum number of batches to fetch in a query. 

 If this attribute is not defined, then the list of all dependent objects is included in the response

200.description: An object with list of dependent objects grouped based on the type

post.description:
To query the details of dependent objects and associate objects as dependents, you can use this API.

 Dependency is defined as relation between referenced and referencing objects. A referencing object is said to have a dependency on a referenced object, if the referenced object cannot be deleted without first deleting the referencing object. 

 Example: 

 Consider a worksheet W1 that has a derived logical column C1 that has a reference to a base logical column C2. This can be shown diagramatically as: W1-->C1-->C2. 

 W1 has a dependency on C2 i.e. W1 is a referencing object and C2 is a referenced object. It is not possible to delete C2 without first deleting W1 because deletion of C2 will be prevented by the relationship between W1s column C1 and C2. 

Similarly C1 is said to have a dependency on C2 i.e. C1 is a referencing object and C2 is a referenced object. It is not possible to delete C2 without first deleting C1 

 Permission: Requires at least view access to the object

id.description: A JSON array of GUIDs of the objects.

formatType.description: The format in which to export the objects
formatType.title: exportObjectTML-formatType

exportAssociated.title: exportObjectTML-exportAssociated
exportAssociated.description:
Specifies if you would like to export the associated objects. To export the objects associated with the objects specified in id, set the value to true. When set to true, the API exports any underlying worksheets, tables, or views for a given object.

 By default, the API does not export these underlying objects

200.description: Successfully exported the requested object as TML

post.description:
To export ThoughtSpot objects represented in ThoughtSpot Modeling Language (TML), use this endpoint. 

 Permission: Requires at least view access to the object

objectTML.description:
A string array of TML objects to upload, in YAML or JSON format. 

 If TML is in YAML format, then use new line characters when there is new line. 

 Example TML: 

 guid: 6d2c1c9b-a407-409c-8c0c-819aeb51350f
table:
  name: TESTINT
  db: SUPPLYCHAIN_MAIN
  schema: PUBLIC
  db_table: TESTINT
  connection:
    name: SnowflakeConnection
  columns:
  - name: C1
    db_column_name: C1
    properties:
      column_type: MEASURE
      aggregation: SUM
      index_type: DONT_INDEX
    db_column_properties:
      data_type: INT64
 

 Example TML in JSON format: 

 {"guid": "6d2c1c9b-a407-409c-8c0c-819aeb51350f", "table": {"name": "TESTINT", "db": "SUPPLYCHAIN_MAIN", "schema": "PUBLIC", "db_table": "TESTINT","connection": { "name": "SnowflakeConnection" }, "columns": [ { "name": "C1", "db_column_name": "C1", "properties": { "column_type": "MEASURE", "aggregation": "SUM", "index_type": "DONT_INDEX" }, "db_column_properties": { "data_type": "INT64" } } ] } }

importPolicy.description:
Policy to follow during import. 

 PARTIAL - Imports all objects that validate successfully, and ignores objects that do not validate successfully. 

 ALL_OR_NONE Imports the objects that validate successfully. 

 VALIDATE_ONLY Validates the objects but does not import them.
importPolicy.title: importObjectTML-importPolicy

forceCreate.title: importObjectTML-forceCreate
forceCreate.description:
Specifies if you are updating or creating objects. To create new objects, specify true. 

 By default, ThoughtSpot updates existing objects that have the same GUID as the objects you are importing. When set to true, the GUID property in the imported TML is replaced on the server, and the response headers will include the id_guid property with the GUID of the new object. The new object will be assigned a new GUID, even if the imported TML file included a guid value. Thus, there is no need to include the guid in the TML file if you are using forceCreate=true.

200.description: Successfully imported the objects in TML

post.description:
To import ThoughtSpot objects represented in ThoughtSpot Modeling Language (TML), use this endpoint. 

 Permission: Requires datamanagement privilge

Note: This endpoint is applicable only for on-prem deployments. 

 To provide details of a table in a schema of a database in Falcon, use this endpoint.

createDatabase.title: createTable-createDatabase
createDatabase.description: Flag to indicate if the database and schema should be created if they do not exist in Falcon. (Valid values: True/False)

schema.description:
DDL of the table to be created. 

 Example: 

 {"database":{"name":"geo"}, 

 "schema":{"name":"falcon_default_schema"}, 

 "table":{"id":{"name":"test_table"}, 

 "primary_key":[{"name":"test_pk"}], 

 "column":[ 

 {"id":{"name":"test_pk"},"size":0,"data_type":"TYPE_INT32"}, 

 {"id":{"name":"test_col1"},"size":0,"data_type":"TYPE_FLOAT"}, 

 {"id":{"name":"test_col2"},"data_type":"TYPE_INT64","datetime":"TYPE_DATE"}, 

 {"id":{"name":"test_col3"},"size":10,"data_type":"TYPE_VAR_CHAR"} 

 ] 

 } 

 }

200.description: Details of the table created

post.description:
Note: This endpoint is applicable only for on-prem deployments. 

 To create a table in Falcon, use this endpoint. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

statement.description:
A JSON array of TQL statements. 

 Each TQL statement should end with semi-colon (;). 

 The TQL operations that can be run through this API are restricted to create database and schema, alter table, delete and update table rows. 

 If a TQL statement fails, then the subsequent statements in the array are not run. 

 Example: 

 alter table test_db.test_schema.test_table drop contraint primary key;

200.description: TQL statements included in the request and the status of each statement

post.description:
Note: This endpoint is applicable only for on-prem deployments. 

 To run a TQL statement in Falcon, use this endpoint. 

 You can run only following type of statements - Table DDL alter and Table rows update and delete. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

offset.description:
The offset point, starting from where the records should be included in the response. 

 If no input is provided then offset starts from 0.

batchNumber.description:
An alternate way to set offset for the starting point of the response. 

 The value in offset field will not be considered if batchNumber field has value greater than 0. 

 Offset value will be calculated as (batchNumber - 1) * batchSize. 

 It is mandatory to provide a value for batchSize with batchNumber.

batchSize.description: The number of records that should be included in the response starting from offset position. If no input is provided, then all records starting from the value provided in offset is included in the response.

sortBy.description: Field based on which the response needs to be ordered.
sortBy.title: searchConnection-sortBy

sortOrder.description: Order in which sortBy should be applied.
sortOrder.title: searchConnection-sortOrder

type.description: Type of the connect being searched. Valid values:
type.title: searchConnection-type

namePattern.description: A pattern to match the name of the connection. This parameter supports matching case-insensitive strings. For a wildcard match, use %.

fetchId.description: A JSON array containing the GUIDs of the connections that you want to fetch.

skipId.description: A JSON array containing the GUIDs of the connections that you want to skip.

tag.description: A JSON array of name or GUID of tags or both. When both are given then id is considered

200.description: Array of connection details matching the search criteria

post.description:
To get the details of a specific connection or all connections in the ThoughtSpot system use this end point. 

 Permission: Requires datamanagement privilege

offset.description:
The offset point, starting from where the records should be included in the response. 

 If no input is provided then offset starts from 0.

batchNumber.description:
An alternate way to set offset for the starting point of the response. 

 The value in offset field will not be considered if batchNumber field has value greater than 0. 

 Offset value will be calculated as (batchNumber - 1) * batchSize. 

 It is mandatory to provide a value for batchSize with batchNumber. 

 Example: 

 Assume response has 100 records. Now,  batchNumber is set as 2 and batchSize as 10, then offset value will be 10. So, 10 records starting from 11th record will be considered.

batchSize.description:
The number of records that should be included in the response starting from offset position. 

 If no input is provided, then all records starting from the value provided in offset is included in the response.

queryString.description: The data search query string. Example: [revenue] > 1000 [ship mode] = air

dataObjectId.description: The GUID of the data object, either a worksheet, a view, or a table.

formatType.description:
The format of the data in the response. 

 FULL: The response comes in "column":"value" format. 

 COMPACT: The response includes only the value of the columns.

200.description: Data for the query string

post.description:
To programmatically retrieve data from ThoughtSpot using search query string, use this endpoint 

 Permission: Requires at least view access to the dataobject and datadownloading privilege

offset.description:
The offset point, starting from where the records should be included in the response. 

 If no input is provided then offset starts from 0.

batchNumber.description:
An alternate way to set offset for the starting point of the response. 

 The value in offset field will not be considered if batchNumber field has value greater than 0. 

 Offset value will be calculated as (batchNumber - 1) * batchSize. 

 It is mandatory to provide a value for batchSize with batchNumber. 

 Example: 

 Assume response has 100 records. Now,  batchNumber is set as 2 and batchSize as 10, then offset value will be 10. So, 10 records starting from 11th record will be considered.

batchSize.description:
The number of records that should be included in the response starting from offset position. 

 If no input is provided, then all records starting from the value provided in offset is included in the response.

formatType.description:

 FULL: The response comes in "column":"value" format.

batchNumber.description:
An alternate way to set offset for the starting point of the response. 

 The value in offset field will not be considered if batchNumber field has value greater than 0. 

 Offset value will be calculated as (batchNumber - 1) * batchSize. 

 It is mandatory to provide a value for batchSize with batchNumber.

 Assume response has 100 records. Now,  batchNumber is set as 2 and batchSize as 10, then offset value will be 10. So, 10 records starting from 11th record will be considered.

batchSize.description:
The number of records that should be included in the response starting from offset position. 

 If no input is provided, then all records starting from the value provided in offset is included in the response.

transientContent.description: If you have embedded ThoughtSpot in your host application, and you want to download Liveboard data with unsaved changes then, pass the transient content from the browser fetch request, using the getExportRequestForCurrentPinboard method. For more information, see https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/?pageid=liveboard-export-api#transient-pinboard . If value for this field is provided, then id will not be considered.

A JSON array of GUIDs of the visualizations in the Liveboard. 

 The vizId field will not be considered when transientContent input is provided.

The format of the data in the response. 

 FULL: The response comes in "column":"value" format. 

 COMPACT: The response includes only the value of the columns.

200.description: Downloaded file for the Answer data

post.description:
To programmatically download Answer data as a file, use this endpoint. 

 The PDF will download data in the tabular format even if Answer is saved as chart. 

 Permission: Requires at least view access to the object and datadownloading privilege

id.description:
GUID of the Liveboard to download. 

 This field is considered only when no input is provided for transientContent field.

vizId.description:
JSON Array of GUIDs of the visualizations in the Liveboard to be included in the downloaded file. 

 For CSV, XLSX and PNG file download, visualization id is mandatory. CSV and XLSX is valid only for visualization of type table and PNG is valid for charts. 

 Only one value will be accepted for these formats. If multiple values are provided then first value in the array will be considered.

transientContent.description: If you have embedded ThoughtSpot in your host application, and you want to download Liveboards with unsaved changes as a file, pass the transient content from the browser fetch request, using the getExportRequestForCurrentPinboard method. For more information, see https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/?pageid=liveboard-export-api#transient-pinboard.

type.description: Type of file to be generated.
type.title: liveboardReport-type

pdfOptions.description: Additional options that are applicable for PDF type.

 Permission: Requires at least view access to the object and datadownloading privilege

200.description: Details of cluster configuration settings

To get details of the current configuration of a Thoughtspot cluster, use this endpoint. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

200.description: Details of overrides of cluster configuration settings

get.description:
To get the details of overrides to the Thoughtspot cluster configuration, use this endpoint. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

configuration.description:
A JSON file with the key-value pair of configuration attributes to be updated.

 Example: {"defaultChartDataSize": 5000}

200.description: Successfully updated the cluster configuration settings

put.description:
To update the Thoughtspot cluster configuration, use this endpoint. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

name.description: User name of the user account.

id.description: The GUID of the user account to query.

newPassword.description: A new password for the user.

200.description: Password reset successful

put.description:
To reset the password of a ThoughtSpot user account, use this endpoint. 

 It is mandatory to use Authorization header with token of a user with admin access to successfully run this endpoint. 

 At least one of User Id or username is mandatory. When both are given, then user id will be considered. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

principalObject.description:
A JSON array of principal objects containing all users and groups present in the external system. 

 Example: 

 { 

 "name": "Customer Success", 

 "displayName": "Customer Success", 

 "description": "CS", 

 "created": 1568926267025, 

 "modified": 1568926982242, 

 "principalTypeEnum": "LOCAL_GROUP", 

 "groupNames": [], 

 "visibility": "DEFAULT" 

 }, 

 { 

 "name": "test", 

 "displayName": "test one", 

 "created": 1587573621279, 

 "modified": 1587573621674, 

 "mail": "test2@test.com", 

 "principalTypeEnum": "LOCAL_USER", 

 "groupNames": [ "Administrator", "All" ], 

 "visibility": "DEFAULT" 

 } 

 You can leave the created and modified dates blank for new users. 

 You can specify if the principal is a user (LOCAL_USER) or user group (LOCAL_GROUP) in the principalTypeEnum keyword. 

 Set visibility to NON_SHARABLE, if you do not want the user to be able to share ThoughtSpot objects with other users in this group.

updateModified.title: syncPrincipal-updateModified
updateModified.description: Specifies whether to apply the changes to users and groups already in the cluster based on the principal object list input.

deleteRemoved.title: syncPrincipal-deleteRemoved
deleteRemoved.description: Specifies whether to delete the users and groups already in the cluster if not present in the principal object list input.

newUserPassword.description:
Assign a password for new users added during the sync operation. 

 All new users added will have this password. It is mandatory to provide value for this field if new users are included in the input list.

200.description: Successfully synced the principals provided as input with the users and user groups in your Thoughtspot cluster.

put.description:
To programmatically synchronize user accounts and user groups from external system with ThoughtSpot, use this endpoint. 

 The payload takes principals containing all users and groups present in the external system. 

 The users and user groups in Thoughtspot get updated for any matching inputs. 

 Any user and user group present in the input, but not present in the cluster, gets created in cluster. 
n You can optionally choose to delete the user and groups from the cluster, that are not present in the input. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

tsObjectId.description:
A JSON array of GUIDs of the metadata objects. 

 To change author of all the objects owned by a user, provide single input as ALL. 

 If multiple object ids along with ALL is provided as input, then ALL will be considered.

fromUser.description:
A JSON object of name or GUIDs of the current author of the objects. When both are given then id is considered. 

 If a list of object ids are provided as input for tsObjectId, then only for those ids that have author as the value provided in fromUser, the author will be changed. 

 Provide either name or id as input. When both are given user id will be considered.

toUser.description: A JSON object of name or GUIDs of the new author for the objects. When both are given then id is considered.

200.description: Successfully changed the author for the objects provided in the request

put.description:
To programmatically change the author of one or several objects from one user account to another, use this endpoint. 

 You might want to change the author of objects from one user to another active user, when the account is removed from the ThoughtSpot application. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege

tsObjectId.description: A JSON array of GUIDs of the metadata objects.

name.description: User name of the user account.

id.description: The GUID of the user account.

200.description: Successfully assigned the author to the objects provided in the request

put.description:
To programmatically assign an author to one or several objects, use this endpoint. 

 Provide either user name or id as input. When both are given user id will be considered. 

 Requires administration privilege.

user.description: A JSON array of name of users or GUIDs of groups or both. When both are given then id is considered.

200.description: Successfully logged out the users included in the request

post.description:
To logout one or more users from logged in session, use this endpoint. If no input is provided then all logged in users are force logged out. 

 Requires administration privilege

type.description: Type of metadata object
type.title: shareObject-type

id.description: A JSON array of the GUIDs of the objects to be shared

permission.description:
A JSON object with GUIDs of user and user group, and the type of access privilge. 

 You can provide READ_ONLY or MODIFY access to the objects. With READ_ONLY access, the user or user group can view the shared object, whereas MODIFY access enables users to modify the object. 

 To remove access to a shared object, you can set the shareMode in the permission string to NO_ACCESS. Example: 

 {"permissions": {"e7040a64-7ff1-4ab9-a1b0-f1acac596866": {"shareMode": "READ_ONLY"}, "f7b8f511-317c-485d-8131-26cf084ef47b": {"shareMode": "MODIFY"}, "7a9a6715-e154-431b-baaf-7b58246c13dd":{"shareMode":"NO_ACCESS"}}}

emailId.description: The email addresses that should be notified when the objects are shared.

notify.title: shareObject-notify
notify.description: When set to true, a notification is sent to the users after an object is shared.

message.description: The message text to send in the notification email

includeCustomEmbedUrl.title: shareObject-includeCustomEmbedUrl
includeCustomEmbedUrl.description: When set to true, ThoughtSpot sends a link with the host application context to allow users to access the shared object from their ThoughtSpot embedded instance.

200.description: Successfully shared the objects to the users and user groups as per the request

post.description:
To programmatically share ThoughtSpot objects with another user or user group, use this endpoint. 

 When you share an object like a Liveboard or visualization, a notification with a live link is sent to the user. When the users access this object, they can view the last saved version of the object. 

 Requires privilege to share the object

id.description: The GUID of the Liveboard to be shared

principalId.description: The GUID of the users and user groups with which you want to share the visualization

emailId.description: The email addresses that should ne notified when the objects are shared.

notify.title: shareVisualization-notify
notify.description: When set to true, a notification is sent to the users after an object is shared.

message.description: The message text to send in the notification email

includeCustomEmbedUrl.title: shareVisualization-includeCustomEmbedUrl
includeCustomEmbedUrl.description: When set to true, ThoughtSpot sends a link with the host application context to allow users to access the shared object from their ThoughtSpot embedded instance.

200.description: Successfully shared the visualization in the liveboard to the users and user groups as per the request

post.description:
If you want to share a specific visualization from a Liveboard with another user or user group, then use this endpoint. 

 When you share a visualization, a notification with a live link is sent to the user. When the users access this Liveboard, they can view the last saved version of the visualization. 

 Requires privilege to share the visualization

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: GUID of the metadata object for which the permission needs to be obtained.

parameters.description: When this field is set to true, the API response includes the permission details for the dependent objects.

200.description: List of user and user groups that have VIEW or MODIFY access to the object

get.description:
To list the permissions for user and user groups on an object, use this endpoint. The response will include only those users and groups with have either VIEW OR MODIFY permission. 

 You can optionally see the permission on the dependent objects as well by enabling includeDependent field. 

 Requires administration privilege

Use this endpoint to list the objects on which a user or user group has permission. The response will include only those objects on which the user or user group has either VIEW OR MODIFY permission. 

 Provide at least one of id or name. When both are given then id is considered.

 Requires administration privilege

tsObject.description: A JSON Array of GUIDs and type of metadata object.

principal.description: A JSON array of principal names or GUIDs. When both are given then id is considered.

includeDependent.title: searchPermissionOnObjects-includeDependent
includeDependent.description: When this field is set to true, the API response includes the permission details for the dependent objects

200.description: List of user and user groups that have VIEW or MODIFY access to the objects

post.description:
To list the permissions for user and user groups on a list of objects, use this endpoint. The response will include only those users and groups that has either VIEW OR MODIFY permission. 

 Provide list of object ids and its type to list the permissions for. 

 You can optionally provide users or user groups for which the persmission needs to be displayed. 

 You can optionally see the permission on the dependent objects as well by enabling includeDependent field. 

 Requires administration privilege

principal.description: A JSON array of principal names or GUIDs to be included in the request. When both are given then id is considered.

tsObject.description: A JSON Array of GUIDs and type of metadata object.

200.description: List of objects on which the users or user groups has VIEW or MODIFY access

Use this endpoint to list the objects on which a user or user group has permission. The response will include only those objects on which the user or user group has either VIEW OR MODIFY permission. 

 You can optionally provide list of object ids for which the persmission needs to be displayed. 

 Requires administration privilege

parameters.name: fromEpoch
parameters.description:
The EPOCH time in milliseconds to set the start time for streaming logs. 

 Example: To set the timestamp as June 1, 2021 8 am, specify 1622534400000.

parameters.name: toEpoch
parameters.description:
The EPOCH time in milliseconds to set the end time for streaming logs. 

 Example: To set the timestamp as July 1, 2021, 8 am, specify 1625126400000.

200.description: Events from the topic specified for the time duration provided

get.description:
Note: This endpoint is applicable only for SAAS deployments. 

 The ThoughtSpot log streaming service API allows you to programmatically get a security audit event log from the ThoughtSpot system.  

 ThoughtSpot cloud deployments allow you to collect security audit events and send them to your Security information and event management (SIEM) application in real-time. 

 These events can help your security operations personnel to detect potential security threats or compromised user accounts in your organization. 

 Permission: Requires administration privilege.

userName.description: Username of the user account for which token is generated

token.description: Bearer token generated. This will be blank when token type is Cookie

tokenCreatedTime.description: Date and time at which the token is generated

tokenExpiryDuration.description: Duration in seconds after which the token expires

displayName.description: Display name of the user account

groups.description: Name of the group to which user account is added

orgs.description: The organizations that user belongs to

state.description: Indicates if the user account is active or inactive

notifyOnShare.description: Indicates if the email should be sent when object is shared with the user

showWalkMe.description: Indicates if the walk me should be shown when logging in

analystOnboardingComplete.description: Indicates if the onboarding is completed for the user

firstLogin.description: Indicates if the use is logging in for the first time

welcomeEmailSent.description: Indicates if the welcome email is sent to email associated with the user account

isDeleted.description: Indicates if the user account is deleted

isHidden.description: Indicates if the user account is hidden

isExternal.description:
Indicates if the user account is from external system
isDeprecated

complete.description: Indicates if the all the properties of user account is provided

isSuperUser.description: Indicates if the user account is super user

isSystemPrincipal.description: Indicates if the user account is system principal

type.description: Indicates the type of user account

parenttype.description: Indicates the type of parent object

tenantId.description: Tenant id associated with the user account

created.description: Date and time when user account was created

modified.description: Date and time of last modification of user account

modifiedBy.description: The user which last modified the user account details

type.description: Type of the connection. The database associated with this type can be obtained from the response returned by the /tspublic/rest/v2/connection/types API endpoint.

name.description: The name of the saved Answer

id.description: The GUID of the saved Answer

querySql.description: SQL query associated with the saved Answer

viz.description: SQL query associated with the saved Answer

FromUserNameAndIDInput.description:
A JSON object of name or GUIDs of the current owner of the objects. When both are given then id is considered. 

If a list of object ids are provided as input for TsObjectId, then only for those ids that have owner as the value provided in fromUser, the owner will be changed. 

Provide either name or id as input. When both are given user id will be considered.

ToUserNameAndIDInput.description: A JSON object of name or GUIDs of the new owner for the objects. When both are given then id is considered.

usersAdded.description: Username of list of users added

usersDeleted.description: Username of list of users deleted

usersUpdated.description: Username of list of users updated

groupsAdded.description: Group name of list of groups added

groupsDeleted.description: Group name of list of groups deleted

groupsUpdated.description: Group name of list of groups updated

orientation.description: Page orientation for the PDF. Default: PORTRAIT
orientation.title: pdfOptionsInput-orientation

truncateTables.description:
When set to true, only the first page of the tables is displayed in the file. 

This setting is applicable only when generating report for specific visualization ids. Default: false
truncateTables.title: pdfOptionsInput-truncateTables

includeLogo.description: Include customized wide logo if available in the footer. Default: true
includeLogo.title: pdfOptionsInput-includeLogo

footerText.description: Footer text to include in the footer of each page of the PDF.

includePageNumber.description: When set to true, the page number is included in the footer of each page. Default: true
includePageNumber.title: pdfOptionsInput-includePageNumber

includeCoverPage.description: When set to true, a cover page with the Liveboard title is added in the PDF. Default: true
includeCoverPage.title: pdfOptionsInput-includeCoverPage

includeFilterPage.description: When set to true, a second page with a list of all applied filters is added in the PDF. Default: true
includeFilterPage.title: pdfOptionsInput-includeFilterPage

date.description: Date and time for the event in the log

log.description: Logged event at the time specified in JSON format. This includes, Event ID, A unique description of the event, for example, User login failed, Timestamp, User ID of the person initiating the event and IP address of the ThoughtSpot instance.
